message.content: The equation $|x - 1| = |x - 2|$ has two cases: $x - 1 = x - 2$ and $x - 1 = 2 - x$. In the first case, $x - 1 = x - 2 \Rightarrow 1 = 2$, which is false. However, in the second case, $x - 1 = 2 - x$. Adding $x$ and $1$ to both sides gives $2x - 1 = 2$, so $2x = 3$ and $x = \boxed{\frac{3}{2}}$.
